Checks if a given list of scored documents is sorted descending with respect to document scores.
CiSS - Class in ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection
Collection-integral Source Selection (CiSS) works as follows: A user's query is submitted to CSI. The retrieved documents are assigned to resources from which they originated.
CiSS() - Constructor for class ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.CiSS
 
CiSSApprox - Class in ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection
CiSS resource selection, where only the score of the top document from each resource is taken into account: 1/2 * exp(doc_score_top) * log(result_length * |resource_size|/|sample_size|)
CiSSApprox() - Constructor for class ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.CiSSApprox
 
compareTo(ScoredEntity<T>) - Method in class ch.usi.inf.lidr.utils.ScoredEntity
NOTE: the natural ordering of scored entities is determined by their scores.
completeRankCutoff - Variable in class ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.AbstractResourceSelection
A rank at which a complete ranking of documents is truncated.
CORI - Class in ch.usi.inf.lidr.merging
Results merging/score normalization algorithm that normalizes document scores using MinMax and weighs them by the relevance of the result list.
CORI() - Constructor for class ch.usi.inf.lidr.merging.CORI
 
CRCSExp - Class in ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection
The exponential version of the CRCS resource selection technique for each document in the top-L increases the score of a corresponding resource by exp^(-beta * doc_rank_sample).
CRCSExp() - Constructor for class ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.CRCSExp
 
CRCSLinear - Class in ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection
The linear version of the CRCS resource selection technique for each document in the top-L increases the score of a corresponding resource by top_L - doc_rank_sample.
CRCSLinear() - Constructor for class ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.CRCSLinear
 
currentRankCutoff - Variable in class ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.ReDDE
The same as AbstractResourceSelection.sampleRankCutoff, but set for each query.

For each sample document starting from lastSeenIndex estimates its source-specific rank according to the following formula: r_c = offset + (r_s - 0.5) * rankRatio.

MergeSort() - Constructor for class ch.usi.inf.lidr.utils.MergeSort
 
MinMax - Class in ch.usi.inf.lidr.norm
The MinMax score normalization algorithm uses the following formula to normalize document scores: s_norm = (s - s_min) / (s_max - s_min), where s_min and s_max are the minimum and maximum scores in the original result list.
MinMax() - Constructor for class ch.usi.inf.lidr.norm.MinMax
 
minNumDocs - Variable in class ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.SUSHI
The minimum number of documents that each resource needs to have for fitting a regression.

Sum - Class in ch.usi.inf.lidr.norm
The Sum score normalization algorithm first shifts the minimum score in a result list to zero: s' = s - s_min.
Sum() - Constructor for class ch.usi.inf.lidr.norm.Sum
 
SUSHI - Class in ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection
For each resource SUSHI learns the transformation function from a document complete rank to a document centralized score: score_c = f(rank_complete).
SUSHI() - Constructor for class ch.usi.inf.lidr.selection.SUSHI

Z

ZScore - Class in ch.usi.inf.lidr.norm
The Z-Score normalization algorithm uses the following formula to normalize document scores: s_norm = (s - mu) / sigma, where mu and sigma are the mean and standard deviation of document scores in the original result list.
ZScore() - Constructor for class ch.usi.inf.lidr.norm.ZScore
